alert.note: Alert for Bullitt; Hardin; Jefferson; Larue; Nelson; Shelby; Spencer (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:19PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Spencer, south central Shelby, Nelson, north central Larue, southeastern Jefferson, east central Hardin and central Bullitt Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 619 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Pioneer Village to 8 miles south of Shepherdsville to near Elizabethtown. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Shepherdsville around 625 PM EDT. Minor Lane Heights around 630 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bardstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Bullitt; Hardin; Jefferson; Larue; Nelson; Shelby; Spencer
